body_content.explanation: a formal meeting or series of meetings of an organization such as a parliament or a court of law:
examples: The parliamentary session is due to end on 27 May.
The UN Security Council met in emergency session to discuss the crisis.

body_content.explanation: a period of time or a meeting when a particular activity takes place:
examples: The 21-year-old runner twisted his ankle in a training session last Friday.
The recording session lasted four hours, during which they were able to get three tracks down.
A minimum of three sessions of acupuncture is advised in the first instance.
She has weekly sessions with a speech therapist.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when people drink a lot of alcohol together:
examples: The men had a heavy session last night .
He drove home drunk after a late-night session in a pub.

body_content.explanation: a period of time during which someone uses a particular computer, network, or software service:
examples: When a client closes a session, the server will receive a disconnect message.
Many people prefer to pick up the phone, rather than open a chat session.

body_content.explanation: at a college, any of the periods of time that a teaching year or day is divided into, or the teaching year itself:
examples: He taught a class during the summer session.
Access is restricted when school is in session.

body_content.explanation: an event at which musicians and singers play and sing together in an informal way, especially playing folk or jazz music:
examples: The pub hosts Irish folk music sessions.
He quickly mastered the piano and was playing in Harlem jazz sessions by the time he was 18.
